200.description: The latest ledger information.

ledger_timestamp.description: Timestamp of the latest ledger version in microseconds.

node_role.description: Role of this node in the network.

git_hash.description: Git hash of the node build.

get.description:
Checks whether the node is healthy.
By default, this endpoint just verifies that the node can retrieve the latest ledger info and returns a `200 OK`.
If the optional `duration_secs` query parameter is specified, the endpoint returns a `200` only if:
`server_latest_ledger_info_timestamp >= server_current_time_timestamp - duration_secs`
Otherwise, it returns a `503 Service Unavailable`.

parameters.name: duration_secs
parameters.description: Threshold in seconds for how far behind the server can be to still be considered healthy. If not provided, the health check always succeeds.

200.description: Server is healthy.

503.description: Server is not healthy (e.g., too far behind).

get.description: Retrieves high-level information about an account such as its sequence number and authentication key.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of account with or without a 0x prefix.

parameters.name: ledger_version
parameters.description: Ledger version to get the state of the account.

200.description: Account information retrieved successfully.

sequence_number.description: A string containing a 64-bit unsigned integer.

authentication_key.description: All bytes (Vec) data is represented as hex-encoded string prefixed with 0x and fulfilled with two hex digits per byte.

response.summary: Example of a valid account response

get.description:
Retrieves all account resources for a given account and a specific ledger version. 
If the ledger version is not specified, the latest ledger version is used.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of account with or without a 0x prefix.

parameters.name: ledger_version
parameters.description: Ledger version to get the state of the account.

200.description: Array of account resources.

data.description: JSON representation of Move struct data within the resource.

get.description:
Retrieves an individual resource from a given account and at a specific ledger version.
If the ledger version is not specified, the latest ledger version is used.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of account with or without a 0x prefix.

parameters.name: resource_type
parameters.description: Name of the Move struct resource to retrieve (e.g. 0x1::account::Account).

parameters.name: ledger_version
parameters.description: Ledger version to get the state of the account.

200.description: The resource data for the specified type.

data.description: JSON representation of Move struct data within the resource.

get.description:
Retrieves all account modules' bytecode for a given account at a specific ledger version.
If the ledger version is not specified, the latest ledger version is used.
The Aptos nodes prune account state history, via a configurable time window. If the requested ledger version has been pruned, the server responds with a 410.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of account with or without a 0x prefix.

parameters.name: ledger_version
parameters.description: Ledger version to get the state of the account.

200.description: List of Move modules (bytecode + ABI)

response.summary: Example of account module with ABI

get.description:
Retrieves an individual module from a given account and at a specific ledger version.
If the ledger version is not specified, the latest ledger version is used.
The Aptos nodes prune account state history, via a configurable time window. If the requested ledger version has been pruned, the server responds with a 410.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of account with or without a 0x prefix.

parameters.name: module_name
parameters.description: Name of the module to retrieve.

parameters.name: ledger_version
parameters.description: Ledger version to get the state of the account.

200.description: A single Move module (bytecode + ABI).

get.description: Retrieves events by account address and creation number. Optionally supports pagination via `start` and `limit`.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address receiving the events (32-byte hex-encoded).

parameters.name: creation_number
parameters.description: Creation number corresponding to the event stream.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Sequence number to start retrieving events from.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to retrieve.

200.description: Array of events from the specified stream.

version.description: Ledger version in which the event was emitted.

type.description: Move type of the event data.

get.description:
Uses the given account `address`, `event_handle`, and `field_name` to retrieve events emitted to the account that match the corresponding event type.
The combination of these parameters constructs a globally unique event stream identifier.
Pagination is supported via `start` and `limit`.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Hex-encoded 32-byte Aptos account address, with or without 0x prefix.

parameters.name: event_handle
parameters.description: Struct type name that contains the event handle.

parameters.name: field_name
parameters.description: Field name within the struct that holds the event handle.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Starting sequence number of events.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of events to return.

200.description: Array of events matching the specified type.

version.description: Ledger version in which the event was emitted.

data.description: JSON representation of the event data.

get.description:
Retrieves block metadata and optionally the transactions contained in the block.
If the block is pruned, the server will return a 410 error. To avoid partial results when `with_transactions=true`, consider checking the total number of transactions expected.

parameters.name: block_height
parameters.description: Block height to look up. Starts at 0.

parameters.name: with_transactions
parameters.description: If set to true, includes all transactions in the block. May be limited by max transaction size.

200.description: Block data with or without transactions.

get.description:
Retrieves block metadata and optionally the transactions contained in the block, based on a specific ledger version.
If the block is pruned, the server will return a 410 error. To avoid partial results when `with_transactions=true`, consider checking the total number of transactions expected.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: Ledger version to look up block information for.

parameters.name: with_transactions
parameters.description: If set to true, includes all transactions in the block. May be limited by max transaction size.

200.description: Block data with or without transactions.

post.description: Retrieves a specific item from the table identified by `{table_handle}` using the provided key. This is a POST endpoint because the key can be complex and not suitable for query parameters.

parameters.name: table_handle
parameters.description: Hex-encoded 32-byte string representing the table handle.

parameters.name: ledger_version
parameters.description: Ledger version to get the state of the account. If not specified, the latest version is used.

key_type.description: The Move type of the key.

value_type.description: The Move type of the value.

key.description: The key to identify the item in the table. Can be a primitive or a complex object.

200.description: The retrieved table item.

get.description: Retrieves transactions sent from a specific account. If `start` is not provided, retrieval starts at sequence number 0. If `start` is too far in the past and pruned, a 410 will be returned.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Address of account with or without a 0x prefix.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of transactions to retrieve.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Account sequence number to start retrieving transactions from.

200.description: List of transactions from the specified account.

get.description:
Estimates a suitable gas price based on recent network activity.
The estimate is derived from the median gas unit price of the last 100,000 transactions. If there have been no transactions in that window, the estimate defaults to 1.
Users can choose to pay more to prioritize their transaction or less if they're willing to wait.

200.description: Estimated gas prices for deprioritized, standard, and prioritized transactions.

deprioritized_gas_estimate.description: Estimated gas price for deprioritized transactions.

prioritized_gas_estimate.description: Estimated gas price for prioritized transactions.

get.description:
Retrieves on-chain committed transactions from the ledger.
Supports optional pagination via the `start` and `limit` query parameters.
If the starting version has been pruned due to the node's data retention policy, a 410 error will be returned.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Ledger version to start the list of transactions.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of transactions to retrieve.

200.description: Array of committed transactions.

post.description:
Submits a batch of transactions to the Aptos network. Each transaction in the batch includes full transaction details, such as sender, sequence number, gas settings, and a payload.
If any transaction in the batch fails, the response will include the corresponding failure details.
Note: The API credit cost for this endpoint is 10.

200.description: Array of failed transactions, if any.

get.description:
Retrieves a transaction from the Aptos blockchain by transaction hash.
If the transaction is not found or has been pruned, the API may return a 404 or 410 respectively.
This endpoint has a credit cost of 10.

parameters.name: txn_hash
parameters.description: The hash of the transaction to retrieve.

200.description: Transaction details for the given hash.

get.description:
Retrieves a transaction from the Aptos blockchain by ledger version.
If the version has been pruned, the server responds with a 410.

parameters.name: txn_version
parameters.description: The version of the transaction to retrieve.

200.description: Transaction data for the given version.

changes.description: List of state changes made by the transaction.

post.description: This endpoint accepts an `EncodeSubmissionRequest`, validates the request format, and returns that request encoded in BCS format as a hex string.

200.description: Encoded transaction in BCS format.

message.description: BCS-encoded transaction as a hex string.

post.description:
Simulates a transaction without committing it to the chain. The output includes transaction events and execution results,  but omits state hashes. Useful for estimating gas usage and transaction validity.
You must provide a SignedTransaction with a zero-padded signature.
Optional flags allow estimating gas price, max gas amount, or using a prioritized gas price.

parameters.name: estimate_gas_unit_price
parameters.description: If true, replaces the transaction's gas unit price with the estimated value.

parameters.name: estimate_max_gas_amount
parameters.description: If true, overrides the max gas with the estimated maximum.

parameters.name: estimate_prioritized_gas_unit_price
parameters.description: If true, uses a higher gas price than the standard estimate to prioritize the transaction.

200.description: Simulation results including execution status and events.
